title: Mitochondrial Ultrastructure and Its Regulation Revealed by Deep Learning-based Analysis
content: Organisms are intricately and three-dimensionally (3D) complex structures composed of nanoscale components. To understand the regulations and roles of the cellular ultrastructure, it is crucial to grasp their 3D structures at the nanometer level in a quantitative manner. Recent advances in serial section EM such as serial block-face scanning electron microscopy (SBF-SEM) and focused ion beam-scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM) have enabled the automatic acquisition of volume EM data. Reconstruction of the volume EM data has made it possible to observe 3D nanometer-scale structures, such as organelles. However, the reconstruction requires a significant amount of labor-intensive work, leading to the limited number of samples to be analyzed in many cases.
